website_summaries.verdict: Worth a look for its innovative design and practical functions. However, it has some durability and longevity concerns.
pros: Stands out for its bell-shaped blending top that delivers notably thorough blending
TurboBoost function provides extra power when needed
cons: Plastic components feel flimsy.Whisk attachment tends to rust
Some blenders stopped working within a few months of use

website_summaries.verdict: A more affordable blender option powered by a 350W motor.
pros: Features the same high-quality design and construction
The blender comes with various attachments that are easy to assemble and remove with a simple click
Splatter protection design keeps messes at bay
cons: Some users felt the buttons were a bit hard to press comfortably

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was an immersion blender by itself. I already have a small food processor and a Nutribullet, so I didn't need a blender to come with all these fancy gadgets and attachments. I just needed something that would blend hot food so I could make soup! (Because ladling hot hot hot liquid into my small food processor or nutribullet made absolutely no sense to me). This was the only brand of immersion blender that was priced well, got decent reviews, and didn't come with a load of extras that I didn't need. I used this immediately after I received it to make potato leek soup and I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy D.

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE BRAUN I USED TO KNOW!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was a Braun, but this product is not the way they used to be. Not as sturdy, no speed control with both speeds practically the same. Requires too much pressure to maintain power. I have arthritis in my hands and this product is impossible for me to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Funk

customer_reviews.title: It died.
customer_reviews.text: This would have been 5 stars--love the blender--but a couple weeks short of a year, it just stopped dead. That's not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Medlock

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, but weak plastic used in construction
customer_reviews.text: Loved it at first. Braun has always been a solid brand for us, but both the bending and whisking attachments have broken within 2 years. The motorbody is solidly designed and powerful but the plastic used for the attachments is garbage. We have never dishwashed or abused the attachments. The bender attachment split within a year and the wisk attachment came apart a few months later. It has been used less than 15 times total and lived in a drawer otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: R. Espana

customer_reviews.title: Died within about 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I was told this one was a good, durable product, but it just quit working within about six months. The shape of the bell was a bit awkward as well, and it would have difficulty with things that a cheaper hand blender did not.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kelly III

customer_reviews.title: The Magic Kitchen Tool - love it in stainless steel and black
customer_reviews.text: Love this blender - it makes preparing soups a breeze. I had an earlier iteration of the Braun hand blender that was white plastic and this is definitely an upgrade in terms of how well the stainless steel part washes and how powerful it is. I also have a Vitamix but I find a hand blender indispensable!

customer_reviews.title: Good but short lifetime
customer_reviews.text: It died today. I bought it 15 months ago, but I didn’t use it frequently. I am quite sad about its lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy Blending
customer_reviews.text: After reading countless reviews of multiple products, I finally landed on the Braun and glad I did. First, the attachments click into place rather than screwing in. So, they are secure and the two push button release is easy to use, even for weak hands. Second, it is powerful. It beats egg whites quickly with the whisk. I used the blade to coarsely puree soup in the pot. It is ideal for that task. No more need for pouring portions of soup into the processor. I had that soup to the desired texture in a few moments. It feels quite substantial. It is so easy to use and clean that I can see it becoming my go to appliance.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQmom

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The blender broke down after only 1 month of light use.
customer_reviews.author: slobodan radivojevic

customer_reviews.title: The design prevents it from venting properly so it won't make a good emulsion. I was very disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to make homemade mayo with it. The design prevents it from venting properly so it won't make a good emulsion. I was very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Can cause cancer or birth defects!!
customer_reviews.text: A product used for utensil/food purposes should not have cancer causing agents. I gave it as a gift and didn’t see any write up about this issue but it was labeled on the gift box.....not cool.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could use the whisking attachment to make meringues and whipped cream but the motor speed or force isnt enough without it making the handle hot. I had to unplug it a couple of times in order for it to cool down and ultimately took 15 min to whip cream, when it normally takes about 5 for a normal hand mixer. Disappointed... I'll be returning! I did receive a box that was severely dented and the handle looked like it had been removed from packaging once before it arrived at my house. There was dust all over it.
customer_reviews.author: mellisecond

customer_reviews.title: German motor now dead
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this item and bought it for the German engineering I trusted so much. I bought this item in March 2017 and the motor burnt out after basic blending in August 2018. I thought this was one of this blenders I would have for much longer than that. Now I’m in the market for a new blender. On a positive note, it served me well until it died.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon R.

customer_reviews.title: This blender is weaker then less expensive models.
customer_reviews.text: Update: (Second Review) After using this for multiple tasks its apparent that this blender does not have the power of some less expensive different brand models that I have had in the past. Still gets the job done, but the lack of power could be an issue with other blending. (First Review)Seems to be a good emersion blender. My only complaint is how far you have to press in the buttons to activate it. Other emersion blenders I have had crapped out so I spent more to get a supposed better quality blender. Will update on how this one hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product for small hands
customer_reviews.text: Great product for small hands. Easy to use with hands even with a little arthritis developing. This is our second Braun. Tried a Cuisinart, but had to come back to this one as it is much easier to operate with just one hand, leaving the other hand to hold the bowl or cup. Machine is nice looking and well built. Also easy to clean and take apart. We are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: jmporg

customer_reviews.title: This hand blender has lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hand blender two years ago. It has been used intermittently but not excessively, perhaps two to three times a month. I bought it to replace a Moulinex hand blender that had worked extremely well for thirty years. Perhaps the manufacturer prefers to have people replace the item every two years to their benefit. However for a consumer it is difficult to understand how my previous blender could last and work well for thirty years and this product for two.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hand blender, and I love it. Now I actually make the vegetable soup recipes I've collected, since I no longer need to batch boiling soup into a food processor. Ergonomically it is not bad, but it IS a little heavier and more awkward than the perfect fantasy hand blender I have in my imagination. I've only used the blender attachment, but all of the attachments are intuitive to pop on and off, and cleanup is simple since they are dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Masyukun

customer_reviews.title: Attachments pick up rust!
customer_reviews.text: Was using the whisk attachment (had previously only lightly used it for whipping up egg whites and batter) and suddenly brown liquid is dripping into my batter. I check the attachment, and at the base of the whisk, rusty brown liquid is literally oozing out. I hope it's rust and not anything worse! This is a contained unit with no way to disassemble or clean the whisk attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect for pureing food.
customer_reviews.text: This blender is great. I use it everyday to puree food for my daughter with special needs. I think it will last longer than the last one I owned. I can't remember the brand but this one is more powerful and a bit easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: blm

customer_reviews.title: this is a GREAT item. I did a lot of research
customer_reviews.text: Well, this is a GREAT item. I did a lot of research, and thought this was the best for the money with the amount of power. I am using it to blend protein powder into homemade coconut yogurt. Smooth and wonderful. Lots of power, easy to clean. High enough to make sure it can handle soups in large pots. Great item. Just bought one for my daughter I loved it so much.
customer_reviews.author: 4now2

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend your money on it.
customer_reviews.text: Died in 5days after purchase! Smoke appears and device never starts again. I'm completely unsatisfied with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ni_pod

customer_reviews.title: Been putting off trying these for years
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure if it was really worth it to buy one of these "boat motors" but America's test kitchen recommended this particular one so decided to try it. Have found many convenient uses for it and EASY to keep clean. Another concern was storage. Not too bulky so it fit nicely in my pull out cabinet divided drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great blender for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blender for my Bullet Proof Coffee. I had to find a blender that accommodates hot liquids for the coffee I drink. I add Brain Octane Oil and Organic Ghee Butter to my Bullet Proof coffee which needs to be blended. Perfect froth and blending. The plastic container that comes with this is over 20 oz. which prevents a 20 oz drink from splattering over the sides. Love the ease of disconnecting the lower portion to clean. Very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Shari L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality.  Broken very easily
customer_reviews.text: Broke the 2nd time I used it. Motor just stopped working completely. Terribly disappointed by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R DiGiacomo

customer_reviews.title: The best blender I have used
customer_reviews.text: The best blender I have used. The part immersed in food is completely stainless steel. Very powerful, effective, easy to clean. The head can also be put in the dishwasher. I have bought a 3 times more expensive one from another brand made in Sweden. This Braun blender is far better.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful. No slow down. Only possible negative ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful. No slow down. Only possible negative is when blending FROZEN fruit the design of the head prohibits the frozen (strawberries) from getting into the blade head. I solved this by letting the fruit thaw a little.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Paxton

customer_reviews.title: Wife likes it.
customer_reviews.text: It feels like a quality built blender. My wife says she wished it had the ability to stay on without have to hold down the button. Clean up is super easy. A quick disconnect of the attachment and your done. As for blending it does a very good job. I would recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: m7

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the whisk but have sued the emersion blender and it has done great for me. I was even using it to mix jams in the cook pot which can get pretty thick but it held up and had plenty of juice for it. SUPER EASY to clean makes it nice. Not that its a terrible thing, but there are two power buttons 1 low power and one high power, but you have to hold the button the entire time or it stops. I'm sure this is for safety reasons but it can be aggravating when you are doing a lot of blending at one time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: believing that the brand carries a reputation of great products. Had a hand Braun hand blender for ...
customer_reviews.text: Always been biased towards Braun, believing that the brand carries a reputation of great products. Had a hand Braun hand blender for over 10 years that worked strong until it decided to give up. Made the mistake of purchasing a Cuisinart hand blender, due to the cheaper price, that after about a year, stopped working. Not only did the accessories end up breaking but the motor gave out too. This is where I decided that the extra cost for buying a Braun hand blender was worth it. Immediately the build quality of the blender and accessories stood out to me in comparison to the failed Cusiniart. After a month or so, the MQ505 blender is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: VuuDuu

customer_reviews.title: Good at blending, but hurts my finger
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the blender attachment for soups, not the whipping attachment. I like the way this blends, but the "on" button must be continuously depressed in order for it to work, which is quite tiring to my fingers. I wish there was on/off switches to keep it running continuously. I would have purchased a different option if I had known about this lack of feature.
customer_reviews.author: cmoore

customer_reviews.title: best product ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had this brand of blender for 10 years. I have used them in Europe in different houses I have had, and now in USA, I was flabberghasted to find the same model with 110 volts. So I am happy! Strong enough for nuts, spices, raw potatoes, I make dough with it, grate 3 year old parmesan with it, grind whole grains into powders, without problems.
customer_reviews.author: 4maha

customer_reviews.title: Great blender! Broken cup...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the blender, which I’m very happy with. I don’t have anything to compare this to, but it worked well for making my soup smooth and creamy. However, I would like to note that the cup came cracked. There seem to be several reviews that have the same thing; so if you really need/want the cup, maybe get a different brand. But it’s also just a plastic cup...
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Not complete
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but came without the whisk attachment. I was surprised since it was pictured and I was not told it wouldn't be included. I was pretty excited about this because whisking by hand sucks and my hand mixer is a nightmare. Sadly, this is really only good for soups. I wouldn't use it for a smoothie in the jar. Just no where near as smooth as you can get with a real blender.
customer_reviews.author: jonas190

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing thick pottery glaze
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Braun MQ505 Multiquick Hand Blender for a non-standard use and it is rocking it out. One family of pottery glazes I use is very thick, settles fast and requires thorough blending before dipping bisque. I'm either lazy or old and didn't want to be stuck handmixing these types of glazes for fifteen minutes until I had a perfect, evenly distributed mixture and a stick blender seemed the obvious choice. The Braun has held up for quite a bit of wear and tear now and is very easy to clean which is important for me to avoid cross contamination between glazes. A+
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Easily the best immersion blender I have used.
customer_reviews.text: My old "wand" finally gave up and I had to find a new one. The review of this one on America's Test Kitchen was enough for me. Since getting this blender, I have used it to make mayonnaise and hollandaise sauce. Using the jar that came with it, I found that I can make both sauces quickly without having to dig out the food processor. Moreover, the mayonnaise is much thicker than the batch I made with the food processor, making it easier to use. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: The Other J. Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: How easy it is to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Impressed on the performance simply place in an appropriate cup filled will semi soft or crisp substance vegetable fruit liquids and in 20 to 30 seconds you’ll get well blended or a liquefy mixture. Release the head place under running water and rinse to clean. This is the easiest tool in the kitchen to clean. Money well spent happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Benn

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old basic Braun stick blender that I used for many years. I tried to mix natural peanut butter in the jar and probably shouldn't have used it for so long without giving it a rest. So it died. This one is not the least expensive, but works well and I expect I'll be able to mix the natural peanut butter, but we'll see. I'm also excited to try the whipping attachment, but haven't yet. Maybe I'll update later.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dean

customer_reviews.title: Fresh whipped cream on demand!
customer_reviews.text: Got this on a flash sale for about $40, and now I have a Vitamix, Nutribullet, and this hand-held, all for different needs. I would never try to make hummus, or even a smoothie with the immersion blender, but it's ideal for blending soups in the pot, or best yet, making fresh whipped cream whenever I want to snack on berries! Clean up on the whisk attachment is no problem, but the other blending tool can be a bit of a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Dave RuffTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: got the product was not sealed and product is not working
customer_reviews.text: Hi, i got this product on time but it was not sealed. on top of that - when i plugged it in - it was not working. now i am stuck with unworking product.
customer_reviews.author: yoni

customer_reviews.title: Dirty item
customer_reviews.text: This “refurbished” item arrived filthy! Someone had obviously used it and didn’t clean it, and then returned it. Rather disgusting. Next time I’ll buy new.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I hate this immersion, it doesn’t blend. It just sucks to the bottom and nothing gets blended unless you constantly move it up and down and still doesn’t work like others. Pushing the button in hurts my finger. You have to push too hard to keep it going.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Cracked Beaker Both Times
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product twice. First one came with a cracked beaker. Second one came with a cracked beaker and a bent blade. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is excellent, and is made in Poland not China
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is excellent, and is made in Poland not China. I was wary of many of the other brands of immersion blenders as reviewers often found they would break or burnout but I am glad I paid a little more and got a quality product built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Klunky, heavy, and does not deliver great smooth texture.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a cuisinart immersion blender. As compared to that, this was heavy, bulky, and lacking in blending power. It has a cap over the blender that prevents splattering, but it also keeps the food encapsulated, which makes it hard to move around the food to make it velvety. You have to lift and move instead of move around the pot. I really hate it.
customer_reviews.author: FSSimon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tool to pure my soups. This was perfect. Works fast and easy to hold and use. My son loves the bonus whisk attachment. Makes it so much easier and faster then doing it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Olena B

customer_reviews.title: Cheapo Plastico
customer_reviews.text: So cheap. It only worked on low out of the box. You had to jiggle with the plastic and hold it extremely hard to get high to turn on. The shaft and everything about it told me it wouldn't last even if it hadn't been broken on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: David Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Handy and speedy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! Like the added whisk utensil! Used to have the Cuisinart but read that their new model required two hands using the safety button. Am now trying this one which has two speeds and is more powerful . I did have to return the first delivery due to a damaged beaker but the second one was sent immediately. Looking forward to using it for soups and sauces.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J. Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Found a good deal on this unit and it works even better ...
customer_reviews.text: My old Braun multi-mixer finally died. They no longer make it so went looking for a replacement. Found a good deal on this unit and it works even better than my old one. Plus the shaft is stainless steel on this compared to the plastic on the old one. I have a full size blender for big tasks, but when I am making small batches on blending hot soup in a pot this is what I use.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: This is great for soups and blending soft baby food. It’s easy to use. I’m giving it 2 stars because it stopped working after 6 months, and the support process isn’t easy
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: How did I go so long without this?!
customer_reviews.text: Much easier to clean than my Kitchenaid mixer, and so far does everything that I used to do in my mixer and more. Bought for Immersion Hollandaise! After washing the attachments in the dishwasher, I turn them upside down in my dish drying rack, otherwise if I use it right away, it sprays water at me that was stuck in there. I wish I would have bought the option with more attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my son,,,, What a wonderful blender.....its quiet.....efficient in mixing.....and easy to clean This mixer has hit my criteria......ease of us.....comfortable to hold....well balanced....easy on ....easy off.....and blends beautifully.....Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: martin martin

customer_reviews.title: beaker crack
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box and there's a crack in the beaker... The durability is so weak that I think the beaker would have been broken if I had put the food in here and worked. So i’ll return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce J.

customer_reviews.title: This little tool is really nifty
customer_reviews.text: I've made several cream soups using the immersion blender attachment and whipped up a small batch of heavy cream in what seemed like seconds. The two attachments snap on and come off very easily. Also a snap to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D.

customer_reviews.title: A well-built, handy tool!
customer_reviews.text: After our Kalorik stick blender self-destructed, we looked at the alternatives available. ATK/Cooks Country recommended this one, and they were right on the mark. Easy to snap together, powerful, and, once unsnapped, very easy to clean. If it holds up in the longer term, it will prove well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I make a yogurt and fruit smoothie at least three times week. 1 cup of frozen fruit, 1 cup of vanilla greek style yogurt 1 cup of cracked ice...check sweetness..add tsp. of sugar or sweetner. The blender stick is strong enough to blend everything smooth. LOVE LOVE LOVE. Use it in the cup you will drink it out of. No waste like there is in a glass jar blender.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: So far works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This is my first handheld mixer gadget but it works perfectly. So far I've only used it for somewhat thin batters and whipping icing but it's been performing perfectly. I've used it several times for 5-minute stretches with no problems (which seemed to be the issue with other products that were reviewed elsewhere) so I'm happy with that.
customer_reviews.author: HMK

customer_reviews.title: Nice kitchen addition
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice so far - once to blend in flour into a sauce that had lumped, and, once to whip cream (with the attached deep cup), so I would not have to drag out my big mixer. It worked splendidly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: This is THE best kitchen appliance purchase I've made in a long time. I hate dragging out my clunky food processor, too many pieces and a nightmare to clean. This immersion blender is easy to use, blends like a charm and there's minimal clean up effort
customer_reviews.author: S. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Very bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very bad purchase. Worked for a week and then just died. I saw the bad reviews earlier but got it anyway. It was a bad decision.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Alternative
customer_reviews.text: We have a very powerful blender. However, taking it out and cleaning it is quite an endeavor. These hand blender do a perfect job for small stuff, are easy to handle and easy to clean. It is not a replacement for a blender, but a perfect alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Harald Modis

customer_reviews.title: Great immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I got this mixer. So far I have used it to blend up soup and gravy in my crockpot and instant pot, and I have also used the whisk attachment to whip up some cream and egg whites. Clean up is fairly easy too. After reading other reviews I’ve just been careful with where I get water so it won’t rust. Running it in a little soapy water and then rinsing it worked beautifully to clean both attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Portable Blender
customer_reviews.text: I use this at work to blend my protein shakes and any smoothies I have on the go. It definitely has the power and blends super well like in a blender. This will be great for cooking soups and used as the immersion blender. Easy to clean and very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great value, fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Received it very quickly. Works great. Bought this to replace a Kitchen Aid I had for years and years. Was concerned I would not be as happy with anything other than Kitchen Aid again, but just didn't want to spend the money. I am impressed with this machine. It is every bit as good without the hefty price tag.
customer_reviews.author: debra starr

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulty blending a can of tomatoes. Had to pull my kitchen aid out of the garbage to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: MED

customer_reviews.title: Purees easily right on the stove top - highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Purees everything without a problem. Used it to make potato soup and it chopped up large chunks of skin-on roasted potatoes easily. Easy to hold, easy to clean, does not splash. So much easier than transferring everything into a blender or food processor. Purees right on the stove top or directly in the slow cooker. Recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This unit does not work well , in my opinion, with the whip; low speed is too fast for liquids causing splashing.
customer_reviews.text: A nice well made unit. However, I think the control switches need to be reworked, as there is not enough difference in the two speeds. With that said I will be returning this hand blender and buying one with a variable speed switch.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sabal

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few times but worked well. Fast to use. Easy to clean..
customer_reviews.author: David P. Folsom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kitchen tool. Great for soups and sauces
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old stick blender that died. My future mother in law called it my “magic stick” after seeing this! Wish I had bought this earlier. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: If it’s damaged on the outside it’s damaged inside too.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product damaged. It arrived in its original damaged box and the plastic cup was cracked. The motor part was all sticky and dusty and the blade arm was scratched on the plastic part. I’m sure it’s a great product I just don’t trust whomever sent it.
customer_reviews.author: lpm

customer_reviews.title: “Boat motor”
customer_reviews.text: Had one for years and it finally bit the dust. This one is even better with a couple of different attachments. Wish it had a stand or rack.
customer_reviews.author: daddysmoney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect blender for the price
customer_reviews.text: I made potato leek soup and the leeks blended away as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Rita L.

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Coronapocalypse Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long? This thing is freakin amazing. Love it for pureeing and for doing small batches of whipped cream or anything else I don't want to break out the stand mixer or food processor for.
customer_reviews.author: Temple

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: We love this product in our kitchen. Use it daily. Wouldn't use anything else. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sfont

customer_reviews.title: Mashed taters? What else?
customer_reviews.text: I got these to make creamy mashed taters but they also made a good job of refried beans. If you've never had creamy refried beans hold up now! Make them from scratch and let this blender at them.
customer_reviews.author: Vornan19

customer_reviews.title: Could be more powerful
customer_reviews.text: It has problems chopping frozen berries... Once thawedg, it does a good job blending everything for smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: senioress

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: Ergonomics is not a good fit for my hand the power buttons could be located better,it's also getting quite noisy as of late. Plus side it does the job and has 2 speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mojoe

customer_reviews.title: blender works great, but was received with broken plastic cup
customer_reviews.text: The stick blender itself is fine, but it was received with a broken plastic cup. As it was a gift, it wasn't opened until after Amazon's return window was closed. and trying to go through Amazon's link to the manufacturer's customer service required me to buy a new part....so the plastic cup will remain broken, and I will remain dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with a cracked beaker
customer_reviews.text: I just unwrapped my recently delivered blender to find that the beaker is cracked in two places.
customer_reviews.author: Eloise

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace this twice because it arrived missing a part and the second time a part was broken. Amazon was very helpful and in the end I got all parts in working order. I love the chop feature
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Black

customer_reviews.title: but this is garbage! it can't stir up protein powder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because I didn't want any other attachments, but this is garbage! it can't stir up protein powder.
customer_reviews.author: moonkat59

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: No issues, does its job. I cant think of any way to make this product better. Its powerful and makes any container into a blender. It clwans easily, assembles easily, and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hobbins

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, shipped quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a product given to a grandson for his first apartment. He loves it ! Uses it regularly for smoothies, and whipped creams, egg whites, etc. I expect that it will last a long time, just as mine has done for last 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Anne VDK

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The one I received was faulty because the second speed button did not work. Also, the whisk head seemed flimsy and I am sorry to say that the cup is made from cheap material. To top it all, the head is on the sharp side, so it can easily damage nonsticks. Is it worth the 60 dollars I paid? Definitely not! I returned it a day after I received it. I am going to look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to hold
customer_reviews.text: After a few minutes this blender get so hot, it's impossible to hold. I had to use my "Grill Armor Extreme Heat Resistant Oven Glove". Also the power button requires a lot of pressure to keep pressed. Do not buy, unless you use less than a minute per use.
customer_reviews.author: pm

customer_reviews.title: Clean up 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: The depth of where the blade is is perfect making it easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Huma A.

customer_reviews.title: wife's elated
customer_reviews.text: Wife's special request for Christmas, she got it. She is elated. Loves the power, feel and the ease of cleaning. This is a replacement of one we have had for years.
customer_reviews.author: FoggDawg

customer_reviews.title: Plastic shavings in the white cream
customer_reviews.text: I did cream and notice the black pieces in it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikita Petrov

customer_reviews.title: Everyday uses good but it’s not power packed magic stick
customer_reviews.text: Basic tasks, this simple model will do but don’t ask for anything strenuous. Motor seems good but not powerful yet it gets things done and recommend for everyday uses.
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: Broke at first use
customer_reviews.text: I tried to make mayonnaise. Burned out motor in blender after a minute of work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: We use this for so many different purposes. During the fall we've been making a lot of potato soup and it's great to create a creamy texture without actually using any dairy products. We also use the whip attachment to mix protein shakes. It's great to be able to take the attachment off and throw it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my little kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I don't have the room for a bigger whisk or blender. This product is perfect and they work really really well. Very impressed. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: mj_photography_webdesign

customer_reviews.title: Great at doing the job
customer_reviews.text: No complaints except there is no sustained "on" button. You have to hold the switch depressed to keep it going. Hard for weaker hands. I see that this is a safety feature .......
customer_reviews.author: anna

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender
customer_reviews.text: Best hand blender in this price range, I just got the blender a few days ago, I used it today for the first time, I love everything about it, the power , feel ,easiness to detach and clean , length of the cord, weight of the device.
customer_reviews.author: Myra Willms

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I bought this... Pros: easy to clean and use Very convenient with instant pot Smoothies, soup, dips... All ready in minutes Can blend hot stuff Cons: blending results a little coarse I had to buy a long jar to blend smoothies
customer_reviews.author: Shetal

customer_reviews.title: Immersion blender, had to have one~
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this blender, have not used it to its full capacity yet, but I then bought another one for my son, he likes it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Atlantis

customer_reviews.title: I've had better Braun products
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to my new Braun hand blender, as I had one one before that I used all the time. This one, however seems not as sturdy. Also not impressed with it's blending power. Not sure if I'm spoiled or the product quality has fallen backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It is super powerful and easy to clean since the attachments are dishwasher safe. I honestly use it all the time to beat eggs, make whipped cream and all sorts of other jobs.
customer_reviews.author: TYarb

customer_reviews.title: A new cook that loves this thing
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this the day after I got it. I use it for all my gravies and sauces now. I even use it for whipping cream up. It is a breeze to clean. You pop off the attachment and into the dishwasher it goes, give the unit a wipe down and your done.
customer_reviews.author: esmereldalee

customer_reviews.title: ... hand blenders for years and have always been very happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Braun hand blenders for years and have always been very happy with the product. I haven't used my new one as yet as am in the process of moving but expect it will perform as well or better than my old one. I bought this because I will have a new kitchen and this one is better looking than the one I have now and because the comments on this item were absolutely glowing.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Five star immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. An upgrade from a cheaper immersion blender; no contest! Very powerful. Purees and smoothies are much fluffier than before. Tools snap on and off easily. Comfortable to operate. A small scraper is recommended to get the goodness out from under the blades.
customer_reviews.author: trickdog

product_meta.title: Braun 2-in-1 Immersion Hand Blender, Powerful 350W Stainless Steel Stick Blender, Multi-Speed + Whisk, 20 oz. Beaker, Easy to Clean, MultiQuick MQ505
product_meta.description: Size:Multiquick 505 Hand BlenderBraun, global leaders in hand blenders, offers new possibilities in creative cooking with the multi-quick 5 Hand Blender, model MQ505. Discover your new favorite cooking tool that fits comfortably in your hand. Multiple attachments give you the flexibility to add fresh twists to everything from dips and sauces to whipped cream and soups.
feature_bullets: Power bell technology: Durable stainless steel blades and unique bell-shaped blending shaft for fast and finer results
Easy click ensures all attachments can be removed with one simple click
Soft grip handle for comfortable use and 20 ounce beaker and whisk attachment included
Note: The unit is designed for the turbo button to be activated with a little more force than the other button BPA free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,632 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
